title: Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme Inaugurated at Mizoram University
content:
507/2025-2026

The inaugural programme of the Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme was held on January 16, 2026, at the Guest House Conference Hall of Mizoram University.

The programme was chaired by Dr. R. Lalchhanhima, Nodal Officer of the programme and Dean, Students’ Welfare, Mizoram University. After welcoming the gathering, Dr. Lalhmingliana, Faculty of Management, presented an overview of the tentative programme schedule for the next two weeks, which includes academic sessions, city visits, and rural immersion activities.

Faculty Coordinators from Lakshadweep and Andaman & Nicobar Islands shared their perspectives, describing the exchange as a unique and enriching experience for students, given the distinct cultural and geographical differences between their home regions and Mizoram. The Chair then invited Mr. Midley B. M. Lyngdoh, Executive Engineer, North Eastern Council Secretariat, who was visiting Mizoram to monitor NEC-funded projects, to deliver a brief address. His speech was followed by remarks from Prof. Pravakar Rath, Pro Vice-Chancellor of Mizoram University.

The Chief Guest, the Vice-Chancellor of Mizoram University, delivered the keynote address, welcoming the participants and providing insights into the state of Mizoram, its people, and culture. He encouraged the students to make the most of the programme, describing it as a “once- in-a-lifetime” opportunity to experience the North-East. As a mark of appreciation, the Vice- Chancellor felicitated Mr. Lyngdoh for attending the inaugural programme despite his busy schedule. The programme concluded with a vote of thanks delivered by Dr. B. Lalzarliana, Faculty of Sociology, Mizoram University.

(NEHHDC),North East Cane and Bamboo Development Centre (NECBDC), Universities, NITs, IITs, Cultural Organizations, etc.

COMPLETED PROJECT(S) DURING JANUARY, 2026

NEC Completes Saiha–Lungbun–Tluangnuam–Haka Road Project in Mizoram under NESIDS (Roads)

The North Eastern Council has successfully completed a major road infrastructure project titled“Upgradation and Improvement of Saiha–Lungbun–Tluangnuam–Haka Road (Lungbun to River Kolodyne), Mizoram under NESIDS (Roads)”at a total cost of ₹45.15 crore.

The project covers a road length of 13 km and benefits seven villages with an estimated population of about 17,500. The road passes through Lungbun village in Saiha district, including certain built-up stretches, and significantly improves connectivity in this remote region.

The primary objective of the project is to enhance international border connectivity with Myanmar in Siaha district of southern Mizoram. In addition to strengthening strategic connectivity, the road is expected to substantially improve the socio-economic conditions of people living in this underdeveloped border area.

The project stands as a significant step towards inclusive development, improved mobility, and enhanced economic opportunities in one of Mizoram’s most remote border regions.

title: Mizoram Governor Inaugurates LESDE Kût 2026 in Aizawl
content:
506/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 10th February, 2026:Mizoram Governor General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh, PVSM, AVSM, YSM (Retd), today inaugurated the 'LESDE Kût 2026 – Accelerating Innovation, Empowering Entrepreneurs' as the Chief Guest. The five-day event, organised by the Labour, Employment, Skill Development & Entrepreneurship (LESDE) Department, is being held from February 10 to 14 at Lammual Ground in Aizawl.

During the inauguration, the Governor also launched two key initiatives under the Mizoram Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWWB): 'Eizawnna Kailawn' – a project focused on skill development for registered construction workers and their dependents – and 'Rahbi Chhertu' – aimed at paving new pathways for construction workers and their families. The LESDE Minister, Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar, was present as the Guest of Honour.

In his inaugural address, Governor General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh commended the Minister and all stakeholders for their dedicated efforts in organising the LESDE Kût. He emphasised that the state's economic progress hinges on creating new livelihood opportunities, the number of youths empowered through skill development, the growth enabled for entrepreneurs, and the effective inclusion of women and rural communities. Highlighting the critical role of the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) sector as a key growth engine for the nation, he noted that India is recognised globally as one of the fastest-growing economies in this domain and serves as a model for other countries. The Governor stressed the need to extend MSME activities even to the remotest villages.

He described Mizoram as possessing a rich cultural heritage, exceptional craftsmanship, strong agro-based potential, and vibrant creative industries, with immense untapped opportunities. The Governor called for concerted efforts to harness these strengths fully. He pointed out that the accompanying Job Fair would serve as a vital bridge between job seekers and employers, urging special attention to the needs of the youth. In today's rapidly evolving economy driven by technology, he said, skills must be continuously upgraded. He encouraged government officials to support entrepreneurs to the best of their ability, while prioritising sustainability and quality. The Governor further urged proactive implementation of various central government schemes to ensure their benefits reach the people effectively. He appealed to the people of Mizoram to leverage the state's peaceful environment, abundant natural resources, and talented population to transform it into a hub of sustainable and inclusive development.

LESDE Minister Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar, in his address as Guest of Honour, remarked that innovation is not confined solely to advanced technology but also emerges from addressing local needs through new businesses, services, and ideas. He described the LESDE Department as deeply connected to people's daily livelihoods and stressed the importance of hand-holding support and market-linked skills to ensure secure employment for Mizo youth. The Minister explained that the LESDE Kût has been organised to motivate both job seekers and employers through interactive engagement. He expressed confidence that the effective implementation of 'Eizawnna Kailawn' and 'Rahbi Chhertu' would create new avenues and significantly improve livelihoods for the people of Mizoram. He also appealed the public to register under the Mizoram Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

Dr. Lalhriatzuali Ralte, Secretary of LESDE, delivered the welcome address. Director Pu John Tanpuia presented a detailed keynote address on the event. Joint Director Pu T. Thangropianga proposed the vote of thanks. Following the formal programme, the Governor visited the 168 exhibition stalls and interacted with participants and visitors.

The LESDE Kût 2026 is a flagship initiative of the Government of Mizoram, designed to showcase services, programmes, and achievements under the LESDE Department and its associated boards and institutions. It aims to bring together youth, MSMEs, entrepreneurs, job seekers, workers, and their leaders for greater awareness, networking, and opportunities in employment, skills, and entrepreneurship. Aligned with the national 'Made in India' and 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' campaigns, the event promotes local products through a state- and regional-level trade fair format. It also seeks to strengthen linkages between Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) in Mizoram and the North Eastern Region with central ministries and various state government departments.

The event was attended by Pu Jeje Lalpekhlua, MLA, along with department officials and special invitees.

title: Larsap-in LESDE Kût 2026 a hawng
content:
4385/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 10th February, 2026:Mizoram Larsap General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh, PVSM, AVSM, YSM (Retd) chuan vawiin chawhnu khan Labour, Employment, Skill Development & Entrepreneurship Department buatsaih, February ni 10-14 chhung awh tur 'LESDE Kût 2026 chu Khuallian niin Aizawl Lammualah a hawng. Larsap chuan Mizoram Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWWB) hnuaia project kalpui tur 'Eizawnna Kailawn' leh 'Rahbi Chhertu' a tlangzarh bawk. He hunah hian LESDE Minister Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar chu Khualzahawm a ni.

Larsap General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh chuan LESDE Kût buatsaih tura Minister leh tha thawhtu zawng zawngte inpekna fakawm tiin, sum lei pai hmasawnna chu eizawnna thar siam chhuah zatahte, thalai chhawr tlak chher chhuah tamahte, entrepreneur chawikan tamahte, hmeichhia leh thingtlang mite tel tam lamahte a innghah thu a sawi a. Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) sector chu ram thanna atana pawimawh tak a nih thu sawiin, India ram chu MSME sector-ah khawvel hriat hlawh leh thang chak berte zinga mi a nih thu leh ram dangte entawn leh zir chian chak a ni, a ti a. MSME hmalakna chu thingtlang kilkhawr thleng phaka kalpui a tul thu a sawi bawk.

Larsap chuan Mizoram chu hnam ziarang hausa tak, kutthemthiam, kuthnathawh lama  theihna nei leh thil siam chhuah kawnga theihna sang tak nei a nih thu sawiin, theihnate hai chhuak tura tanlak a tul thu a sawi a. Job Fair buatsaih chuan hna zawngtu leh ruaitu inkar a hnawh khah dawn thu sawiin, thalaite chu ngaihven turin a chah a. Tunlai thiamna behchhan khawvel sum leh pai dinhmun thang chak tak karah kan thiamnate tihpun ve zel a tul thu a sawi a. Sawrkar hotute chu entrepreneur chawikan phute theihtawp chhuaha pui tura fuihin, nakin hun thleng daih tur leh belhchian dawl hmalakna ngaipawimawh turin a chah a. Sawrkar laipui scheme hrang hrangte mipuite zirtira, a hlawhtlin ngei theih nana tanlak a tul tih sawiin, state ralmuang, leilung hausa leh theihna nei kan nihna chu chawr tangkaia hmasawnna tlo leh huapzo nei state siam turin mizo mipuite a chah a ni.

Khualzahawm LESDE Minister Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar chuan LESDE Department chu nitin khawsak leh eizawnna nen a inngheng tlat tih sawiin, mizo thalaite'n eizawnna ngelnghet an neih theih nana puih, bana kaih leh zawrh ngam thiamna neih tir an ngaipawimawh tih a sawi a. LESDE Kût kaltlangin office dawr tura hmun hran hran kal ngai lova hmun khata dawr theih tura ruahmanna siam a nih thu sawiin, thalai hna zawng lai leh la zawng turte huikhawma fuih phur turin he Kût hi siam a ni, a ti a. Eizawnna Kailawn leh Rahbi Chhertu project-te chuan hmasawnna thar siamin, mizote eizawnna a siam sak dawn tih a sawi a. Mizo mipuite chu Mizoram Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board chu ngaihvena inziaklut turin a sawm nghal bawk.

He hunah hian Dr. Lalhriatzuali Ralte, Secretary, LESDE Department chuan kalkhawmte lawmna thu a sawi a. Director Pu John Tanpuia'n LEDSE Kût chungchang a sawi zau a. Pu T. Thangropianga, Jt. Director, LESDE Department-in lawmthu sawiin hun hman a khar hnuah, Larsap-in stall hrang hrang 168 te tlawh kualin a nghaktute a kawm a ni.

LESDE Kût hi Mizoram Sawrkar hmalakna niin, LESDE Department leh a kaihhnawih board leh institution hnuaia service, programme leh hlawhtlinnate phochhuah a ni a. Thalai, MSME, entrepreneur, hna zawng mek, hnathawktu leh anmahni kaihruai theitu turte chu a kaihhnawih peng hrang hrangte nen thlunzawmin, hna, thiamthil leh hamthatna dangte hre chiang turin hun tha a siam sak a ni. Made in India leh Atmanirbhar Bharat chawilarna niin, state leh regional level trade fair kaltlangin thil siam hrang hrang phochhuah a ni a. Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) nen tangkawpin Mizoram leh North Eastern Region-a entrepreneur-te Sawrkar laipui hnuaia Ministry leh Mizoram Sawrkar Department hrang hrangte nen a thlunzawm bawk.

He hunah hian Pu Jeje Lalpekhlua, MLA , Department thawktute leh sawm bikte an tel a ni.

title: PRINCIPAL SECRETARY-IN ‘ONE-DAY STATE LEVEL CONFERENCE OF PRINCIPAL CENSUS OFFICERS’ A KAIHRUAI
content:
4383/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, the 10th February, 2026:Pu Sudhir Kumar, Principal Secretary leh Census of India, 2027 atana State Nodal Officer chuan vawiin khan Mizoram Secretariat-ah 2027-a India Inchhiarpui lo awm tur chungchanga intawhkhawmna, ni khat awh ‘State Level Conference of Principal Census Officers’ a kaihruai.

He Conference-ah hian an awmna huamchhung theuha Principal Census Officer-a ruat, district zawng zawnga Deputy Commissioner te leh Aizawl Municipal Corporation hnuaia Municipal Commissioner zawng zawng te bakah Census kalpui tura nodal department, General Administration Department-a officer te an tel a ni.

Kalkhawmte lawm pahin hun kaihruaitu Pu Sudhir Kumar-a chuan Census of India, 2027 chu fiahna hmanga thil ruahmanna, rorel kalhmang siamna leh ram hausakna intluktlang taka semzaina atana ram pum huapa kalpui thin pawimawh tak a ni tih a sawi a. Principal Census Officer-te chu Census Act, 1948 leh Census Rules-in an mawhphurhna a tuksakte taima taka hlenchhuak turin a fuih a. Hna a hun taka dik taka zawh a nih theih nan district leh local level-a census kaihhnawih thil reng reng uluk taka vil a pawimawhzia a sawi bawk a ni.

Pu Jamil R. Swer, Deputy Director, Directorate of Census Operations, Mizoram atangin Census of India, 2027 kalpui tum a nih dan presentation chipchiar tak ngaihthlak a ni a. Census Phase-I Houselisting and Housing Operation (HLO) chu Mizoramah April ni 16, 2026 atanga May ni 15, 2026-ah kalpui a nih tur thu a sawi a. Phase I-a mahni inziahluh thiehna (self-enumeration) chu April ni 1 atanga ni 15, 2026 chhungin siam a ni ang tih a sawi bawk a. HLO Phase-a zawhna zawh dan tur kalhmang leh digital hmanraw hman turte tarlangin, Census lo awm tur chu India rama digital mode hlanga Census kalpui hmasa ber tur a nih thu a sawi bawk a ni. Census tluang leh hlawhtling taka kalpui a nih theih Department hrang hrang – Rural Development, Forest, Information and Public Relations, leh a dangte – leh Urban Local Body-te nena thawhhona a pawimawh thu a sawi bawk a ni.

Pu Shivam, Assistant Director, Directorate of Census Operations, chuan kalkhawmte chu digital platform hrang hrang thawh dan a hrilhfiah a, hei hian Census Management and Monitoring System (CMMS) portal, Houselisting and Housing Census (HLBC) system, mobile application leh a thlen ruala hmasawnna chhuizuina monitoring dashboard a huam a ni.

Pu Lalrohlua, Joint Secretary, General Administration Department pawhin inruahmanna kalpui tawhte a tarlang a. Hei hian census functionary ruat, and mawhphurhna turte, district hrang hranga training kalpui hun turte leh Phase lo awm zel tura kal dan turte a huam a ni.

Principal Secretary Pu Sudhir Kumar chuan Principal Census Officer-te chu census kaihhnawih hna dah pawimawh ber tur leh Mizorama Census of India 2027 hlawhtling taka kalpui a nih theih nana department hrang hrangte inkara thawhhona tha awmtir tura chahin Conference hi a khar a ni.

title: PRINCIPAL SECRETARY CHAIRS ONE-DAY STATE LEVEL CONFERENCE OF PRINCIPAL CENSUS OFFICERS
content:
505/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, the 10th February, 2026:A one-day State Level Conference of Principal Census Officers was convened today at the Mizoram Secretariat in connection with the Census of India, 2027. The Conference was chaired by Pu Sudhir Kumar, Principal Secretary and State Nodal Officer for Census of India, 2027.

The Conference was attended by all Deputy Commissioners of the districts and the Municipal Commissioner of Aizawl Municipal Corporation, who have been designated as the Principal Census Officers within their respective territorial jurisdictions, along with officers from the General Administration Department, the nodal department for conduct of Census.

While welcoming the participants, the Chairman, Pu Sudhir Kumar, emphasized the importance of the Census of India, 2027 as a key national exercise that provides the foundation for evidence-based planning, policy formulation and equitable allocation of resources. He urged all Principal Census Officers to discharge their responsibilities diligently as envisaged under the provisions of the Census Act, 1948 and the Census Rules made thereunder. He further stressed the need for close supervision and effective monitoring of all census-related activities at the district and local levels to ensure timely and accurate completion of the work.

Pu Jamil R. Swer, Deputy Director, Directorate of Census Operations, Mizoram, made a detailed presentation on the strategy for the Census of India, 2027. He informed that the first phase of the Census, namely the Houselisting and Housing Operation (HLO), will be conducted across the State from 16th April, 2026 to 15th May, 2026. He also stated that the facility for self-enumeration for the first phase would be made available from 1st April to 15th April, 2026. He highlighted the nature of questions to be canvassed during the HLO phase and gave an overview of the digital tools to be deployed, noting that the upcoming Census would be the first Census in India to be conducted fully in digital mode. He also sought active cooperation from various stakeholder departments such as the Rural Development Department, Urban Local Bodies, Forest Department and the Information and Public Relations Department for the smooth and successful conduct of the Census.

Pu Shivam, Assistant Director, Directorate of Census Operations, briefed the Conference on the functioning of various digital platforms, including the Census Management and Monitoring System (CMMS) portal, Houselisting and Housing Census (HLBC) system, mobile applications and the monitoring dashboard for tracking progress in real time.

Pu Lalrohlua, Joint Secretary, General Administration Department, provided an overview of the preparatory activities undertaken so far, including the appointment of census functionaries, their roles and responsibilities, training schedules across districts and the roadmap for the forthcoming phases.

The Conference concluded with an address by the Principal Secretary, Pu Sudhir Kumar, who directed all Principal Census Officers to accord top priority to census-related work and to ensure close coordination among all concerned departments for the successful conduct of the Census of India, 2027 in Mizoram.

title: NOTICE REGARDING WORKS CONTRACT, DEPARTMENTAL WORKS AND GST PAYMENT
content:
504/2025-2026

Aizawl the 10th February, 2026 :It has been observed that there is a prevailing misconception among various Government Departments that GST payment is not required when works are executed without engaging a Contractor (Departmental Works). Due to this, a significant amount of Government Revenue is being lost.

As this is against the law, the following notification is issued to prevent difficulties for Drawing and Disbursing Officers (DDOs) and Contractors/Suppliers:

1. "Departmental Work"is NOT Exemptfrom GSTEven when a Department executes work on its own without engaging a Contractor (Departmental execution), it is not exempt from GST.(Ref: FinanceDepartmentNotificationNO.G.17018/1/02-FEC dated31st January2025)

Finance Department, Govt. of Mizoram, has stated that whenever any Department executes Departmental Work without a contractor, they must pay the applicable GST on all procurement of required materials (Cement, Rod, etc.). Departments executing Departmental Works must not purchase materials from Dealers/Shops that do not have GST registration. All materials for Government works must be purchased only fromGST Registered Dealers,and aTax Invoicemust be obtained.

2. The "GST Component" in Work Order/Sanctioned FundIt is important for thepublic and Government employees to know that funds sanctioned for Governmentworks (Road construction, Building construction, etc.) are prepared based on theSchedule of Rates (SOR).In the SOR estimate, besides the material/labor cost, the GST to be deposited to the Government is already included.

title: National Deworming Day 2026 (February Round) Observed in Lunglei District
content:
503/2025-2026

Lunglei, 10 February 2026:The first round of National Deworming Day (NDD) 2026 – February Round was observed today across Lunglei District to provide deworming medication to children and adolescents aged 1–19 years.

The district-level programme was launched at Government Middle School–I, Rahsiveng, with Lunglei District Additional Deputy Commissioner Pi Rochuangkimi Khenglawt as the chief guest. She administered Albendazole tablets to selected students and emphasised the importance of good health, hygiene and cleanliness for children’s overall development. She advised regular handwashing, maintaining personal and environmental hygiene, consuming clean food and water, and urged parents and teachers to inculcate hygienic habits among children.

The programme was chaired by Child Development Project Officer Pi R. Lalhmingliani, who stated that National Deworming Day is observed twice a year across India. District Deputy Chief Medical Officer Dr Christina Zonunmawii highlighted the ill effects of intestinal worms and informed that free Albendazole tablets are provided twice yearly, with half a tablet for children below two years and one tablet for those aged 2–19 years.

Sub-Headquarters MHIP representative Pi Vanlalthangi Chhakchhuak demonstrated proper handwashing techniques. Headmaster Pu James Vanlalrema also spoke on the occasion, while the vote of thanks was delivered by Deputy District Programme Coordinator (Samagra Shiksha) Pu HS Lalfakzuala.

Under the NDD 2026 February Round, 44,526 children have been targeted in Lunglei District through schools, colleges and anganwadi centres. Out-of-school children are being covered through door-to-door visits by ASHA workers. A Mop-Up Day is scheduled on 17 February 2026 to cover those missed during the main round.

title: MIZORAM UNIVERSAL HEALTHCARE KALPUINA TUR ADB LOAN SIGN A NI TA
content:
4377/2025-2026

Aizawl, 10th February, 2026 :Finance department, Government of Mizoram chuan a hnuaia tarlan ang hian Mizoram State Healthcare Scheme changtlung zawka kalpuina tur ADB loan sign a nih thu thuchhuah an siam.

Mizoram sawrkarin Mizoram State Healthcare Scheme changtlung zawk kan neih theihna turin Asian Development Bank atanga loan assistance hmuh tuma rei tak hma a lo lak tawh chu tih puitlin niin Loan agreement sign fel a ni ta. Supporting Public Health Care System Strengthening To Achieve Universal Health Care For Mizoram atana ADB loan lakna tur chu kumin January ni 23 khan ADB Headquarters, Manila-ah sign a ni ta a, India aiawhin Baldeo Purusartha, Joint Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance chuan a sign a, ADB aiawhin Mio Oka, Country Director, Director, India Resident Mission chuan signin, Mizoram sawrkar aiawhin Ramchuana, Finance Secretary chuan a hmuna kal loin e-mode in a sign ve bawk a, Loan ID L-4718 pek a ni.

Hemi atan a Mizoram sawrkarin loan project a siam “Improvement of Mizoram State Health Care Scheme by enhancing the Corpus Fund” tih chu May ni 31, 2022 khan Ministry of Finance chuan a lo pawm tawh na a, harsatna hrang hrang avangin approve theih lohin a awm a, tun sawrkar hian thar thawh lehin “Supporting Public Healthcare System Strengthening to Achieve Universal Health care for Mizoram” tiha thlak a ni.

Hemi hnu hian tih tur hrang hrangte tih a ni a, Ministry of Finance lama harsatna kan tawh loh nan Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma leh Health Minister Pi Lalrinpuii te chuan Union Finance Minister chu hmaichhan ngeia sawipuiin, D.O. letter te an pe tel nghal bawk a. Department of Expenditure, Ministry of Finance a zohnahthlak Secretary awm thar – Pu Vumlunmang Vualnam, IAS pawh hmai chhan ngeia hmu in, theihtawp min chhuahpui turin ngen a ni bawk.Tin, Finance Department lama kan hotute pawhin nasa taka bawhzuiin, Central Ministry-ah pawh zuk kal chilha nawr a ni.

Tichuan, rei tak buaipui a nih hnuah October ni 23, 2025 khan loan negotiation neih niin ADB Board chuan December ni 5, 2025 khan loan chu a lo approve ta a ni. Loan approve a nih hnu hian thlasik chawlhin a zui avangin beisei anga hmaah loan agreement hi sign a ni lo a, January ni 23 khan hybrid mode (a tak leh video mode tangkawp) in sign a ni ta chauh a ni.

Mizoram Universal Healthcare atana ADB atanga loan hmuh zat (loan component) hi USD 108 million niin,India pawisa chuan Rs 800 crore (approx) a ni a. ADB loan pumpui hi Ministry of Finance hnuaia Externally Aided Projects hnuaia hmuh a nih avangin Government of India-in a rulh tur a ni. Government of India, Ministry of Finance in a rulhna tur interest rate hi SOFR (Secured Overnight Financing Rate) tih niin 3.6% per annum vel bawr ni tura chhût a ni a. Central sawrkar hian loan pumpui atanga 90% hi grant angin Mizoram a pe ang a, 10% (Rs 80 crore) hi Mizoram sawrkar hnenah loan anga Mizoramin a rulh ve turin a puktir chhawng dawn chauh zawk a ni. Mizoram sawrkarin he 10% a rulh ve tur chin a rulhna tur interest rate hi chu Central sawrkara Ministry of Finance in a la ruahman tur a ni a, State Development loan (OMB) ang vel tura beisei niin 7-8% interest vel tur a ni ang.

MUHCS atana ADB atanga sum puk hi thil danga hman tur a ni lo a, MUHCS Corpus Fund atan chauha hman tur a ni. Loan amount atanga zaa sawmkua (90%) lai Government of India in a rulh dawn avangin MUHCS atana State Sawrkar sum sen chu nasa takin a tlahniam dawn a ni.

Tin, he loan hi a lo hlawhtlin theihna tura theihtawp min chhuahpui tu, Ministry of Finance, Department of Expenditure-a Secretary atana kan zohnahthlak awm thar, Pu Vumlunmang Vualnam chungah te,   Department of Economic Affairs-a Joint Secretary, Juhi Mukherjee, Serchhip DC hlui, a bul atanga a tawp thlenga theih tawp min chhuahpui tu chungah te, Ministry-a thawktu zawng zawng te, ADB lam atanga hemi buaipuitu Dr. Nishant Jain leh a team-te bakah, Mizoram lam tih tur hrang hrangte tha taka lo ti zel tu, Mizoram State Healthcare Society chungah Mizoram sawrkar, Finance Department chuan lawmthu a sawi tak meuh meuh a ni.

title: Lungleiah kum 2026 atana rulhut hlo pek runpui thawh khatna (National Deworming Day) kalpui a ni
content:
4375/2025-2026

Lunglei, 2026 Ramtuk thla ni 10:Vawiin khan Lunglei District pum puiah kum 2026 atana rulhut hlo pek runpui thawh khatna, National Deworming Day (NDD) 2026 February Round kalpui a ni a. Government Middle School-I, Rahsiveng, Lungleia he ni puala a hawnna hun buatsaih chu Lunglei District Additional Deputy Commissioner Pi Rochuangkimi Khenglawt chuan Khuallian niin a hmanpui a, zirlai naupang ṭhenkhat rulhut hlo (Tablet Albendazole) a eitir.

Khuallian Pi Rochuangkimi Khenglawt chuan zirlai thiam thei leh rilru chak ni turin taksa hrisel a pawimawh thu leh hrisel tur chuan thianghlimna ngaih pawimawh a ṭul thu sawiin, zirlaite chu faina leh thianghlimna ngai pawimawh turin a chah a. Rulhut pai lo tur leh taksa hriselna atan kut sil fai ṭhat te, kut tin tihfai ṭhat te, mahni taksa leh chenna in leh a vel vawn fai te, thlai leh thei ei tur sil fai ṭhat leh tui thianghlim chauh in te a pawimawh tih vawng reng tura chahin, nu leh pa leh zirtirtute chu naupangteah faina leh thianghlimna ngaih pawimawhna tuh tum turin a chah.

He hun hi Lunglei Child Development Project Officer (CDPO) Pi R. Lalhmingliani'n kaihruaiin, naupang kum 1 — 19 inkarte rulhut laka ven nan National Deworming Day chu India ram pumah kum tin ṭum hnih hman ṭhin a nih thu a sawi a. Lunglei District Deputy Chief Medical Officer Dr Christina Zonunmawii chuan Powerpoint presentation hmangin mihring tana rulhut ṭhat lohzia leh rulhut hlo ei a pawimawhzia tar langin, rulhut pai lo turin kum khatah rulhut hlo vawi hnih tal ei a ṭhat thu a sawi a. Sawrkarin naupang kum 19 hnuai lam tan kum tin ṭum hnih a thlawna rulhut hlo a pek thu sawiin, naupang kum 2 hnuai lamte chu Albendazole mum chanve pek ṭhin an nih thu leh kum 2 leh 19 inkar chu mum khat pek ṭhin an nih thu a sawi.

Sub-Headquarters MHIP ai awh Pi Vanlalthangi Chhakchhuak chuan kut sil dan a taka entirin, naupangte a zirtir a. Govt Middle School-I, Rahsiveng Headmaster Pu James Vanlalrema pawhin thu sawiin, Deputy District Programme Coordinator (Samagra Shiksha) Pu HS Lalfakzuala'n lawm thu sawiin hun a khar.

NDD 2026 February Round-ah hian Lunglei District chhungah kum 1 — 19 inkar rulhut hlo pek tur tinzawn 44,526 awmin, sawrkar sikul, mimal sikul leh anganwadi centre-ah te rulhut hlo hi pek vek tum a ni a. Vawiin khan District chhunga school, college leh anganwadi centre-ah rulhut hlo hi pek niin, school kai lote chu ASHA-te'n an inah kal chilhin an pe bawk a. Target zinga tel si, vawiina pek hman lohte pe kim tura thual nawn ni (mop up day) atan February ni 17 ruahman a ni.

He hun hi Women and child Development, Education Department, PHE leh ANM School, Zemabawk staff ten an telpui a niAnganwadi naupangte rulhut hlo eitir nghal an ni.

title: AH & VETY MINISTER IN RANVULHTUTE TAN ANIMAL INSURANCE A TLANGZARH: BANAKAIH SCHEME PROGRESS PARTNER TE TAN CHAWI A AWM DAWN LO
content:
4369/2025-2026

Aizawl, 10.02.2026:Vawiin khan Planning & Programme Implementation Dept Committee Room-ah AH & Vety Minister Pu C Lalsawivunga chuan ranvulhtute tan Animal Insurance a tlangzarh. Hemi atan hian National Insurance Company Ltd. leh AH&Vety Department Secretary Pu Lalsangliana ten Minister leh MSPCC Vice Chairman Dr. KC Lalmalsawmzauva hmaah thawhhona thuthlung an ziak a ni.

He Animal Insurance hian ranvulh hrang hrang (vawk, bawng, sial, kel, berawm) a huap dawn a. Implementing agency atan National Insurance Company Ltd thlan an ni. Premium zaa sawmpanga (15%) hi ranvulhtu ten an tum ve tur a ni a, Handholding hnuaia progress partners te erawh chu handholding atanga tumsak vek an nih dawn thung. Vawk vulh insurance atan cheng 2000 chawi tur kha cheng 292 chauh farmer (Bana Kaih Scheme progress partner ni lo) ten an tum a ngai dawn a ni.

Minister Pu C. Lalsawivunga chuan ranvulhtute mamawh em em ran insurance kalpui tak tak tura hmalakna a awm ta chu lawmawm a tih thu a sawi a. Insurance Company tam zawkin animal insurance an tuipui loh thu leh, ASF avanga Mizoramah insurance company kohluh an har thu sawiin, Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma'n Sorkar laipuiah thlen in, Insurance Company hrang hrang Head Office ah lehkha a thawn avanga tun dinhmun thleng ta an nih thu a sawi bawk.

Minister chuan Mizoram chu vawksa ah a intodelh dawna a lan mek laiin kum 2021 atanga ASF leng chuan nasa takin vawkvulhtute a nuai thu leh, kha hrilen atang khan ngai an awh leh tawh loh thu te, ASF avanga vawkvulhtute sum hloh hi vaibelchhe zakua sawmruk (Rs 960 crore) a tlin tawh thu a sawi.

Minister chuan sorkarin animal insurance ah theihtawp a chhuah thu sawi zuiin, Animal Insurance-a State Matching Share 30% pawh 10% a tihhniamsak turin Union Minister ah a ngen thu leh Mizoram ngenna angin 10% ah tihhniamsak a nih thu a sawi a. Vawiina insurance tlangzarh tak atan hian Central atangin Rs 66.49 lakhs hmuh a nih thu leh, hei hi first installment chauh niin, first instalment ah hian ran 4545 insured tum anih thu a sawi a. Sorkar chu ranvulhtute hmangaihtu anih thu leh ASF avanga tuar te tawrhpui nan ASF chu state specific disaster ah puan anih tawh thu te, ASF tuarte zangnadawmna compensation pek thin an nih thu te a sawi bawk.

Animal Insurance hnuaiah hian National Insurance Co. Ltd. atangin insurance dil dan tur tlangpui leh insurance hmuh theih dan te ngaihthlak a ni a. Insurance claim hi state dang a refer ngai lovin Aizawl ah chinfel theih a nih tur thu an sawi a ni.

title: KOLASIBAH NATIONAL DEWORMING DAY FEBRUARY ROUND HAWNG
content:
4368/2025-2026

Kolasib, the 10th February, 2026:Vawiin chawhma khan Kolasib-a Senior Chief Medical Officer (CMO) Office bultumin Anganwadi Centre-V, Project Veng, Kolasib-ah 'National Deworming Day (NDD) February Round' hawnna hun hman a ni a. Dr. RK.Lalthlamuana, Sr. CMO, Kolasib chuan khuallian niin he hun hi a hawng.

Khuallian Dr. RK Lalthlamuana chuan National Deworming Day chu kumtin February thla leh August thlaah te neih thin a nih thu sawiin, naupangte hriselna atana a pawimawhzia a tarlang a. Rulhutin taksa mamawh vitamins leh chaw tha te a lo ei then ve thin avangin mihringah harsatna leh hrisel lohna tam tak a thlen thin a, chuvangin rulhut laka kan fihlim theihna turin faina leh thianghlimna kawngah tan lak a tul a ni, a ti.

Sr. CMO chuan rulhut damdawi (Albendazole) chu damdawi ei him tak, mihringah harsatna thlen hriat ala awm loh thu leh a eitur te chuan thialsawm vek tura tih an nih thu a sawi bawk a ni.

He hun hi Dr. Ramdinthari, Deputy Chief Medical Officer, Kolasib chuan a kaihruai a. National Deworming Day February Round-ah hian Kolasib District huamchhunga naupang kum 1 atanga kum 19 inkar mi 32,730 te hnenah rulhut damdawi hi pek tura target niin, vawiina la ei hman lo te tan February ni 17, 2026 (Mop-up Day) khian pek zawh vek tura ruahman a ni.

Hawnna inkhawm neih zawh hian Anganwadi naupang te hnenah rulhut damdawi eitir nghal an ni.

title: LAWNGTLAI DISTRICT 'BAWRHSAP AWARD' THLIRLETNA NEIH A NI
content:
4367/2025-2026

Lawngtlai, 10th Febuary, 2026 :Vawiin chawhma dar 11:00 AM khan DC Office Chamber -ah Lawngtlai Bawrhsap Pu Donny Lalruatsanga hovin, Faina leh Thianghlimna, Veng inrelbawlna tha thlanna 'Bawrhsap Award' kalpuivmek chungchang sawiho a ni.

Bawrhsap Pu Donny Lalruatsanga chuan a tumkhatnan kumin Republic Day ah Lawngtlai khawpuia veng hrang hrangte tana inelna Bawrhsap Award sem a nih thu sawiin, Veng hrang hrang Village Council leh Tlawmngai Pawlte inpekna leh thawhrimna fakin, mipui lamin an theih ang tawka tha an thawh chu 'Bawrhsap Award' hlawhtlinna pawimawh tak a ni, a ti . Bawrhsap Award- chu kumtin a kalpui tura ruahman a nih ang a veng hrang hrangte chu thahnemngai zawka hmala tura ngenin, a endikhna thawktu MJA Lawngtlai District chungah Bawrhsap chuan lawmthu a sawi nghal bawk.

Pu Donny Lalruatsanga chuan LADC- ah sawrkarna mumal tak din a nih hunah LADC nen tangtlanga 'Clean Lawngtlai' leh Lawngtlai Beautification - ah te hmalakna kalpui tuma ruahmanna neih a nih thu a tarlang bawk a ni.

He huna tel VC leh MJA Member-  te chuan Lawngtlai Bawrhsap - in khawpui inrelbawlna tha  a veina chuan rah tha a chhuah tan nia an hriat thu tarlangin,  hmasawn zel  tura  theihtawp chhuah an inhuam thu an sawi a ni.
